title: Laws of Cleansing
shortSummary: Leviticus 14 outlines the detailed laws for the ceremonial cleansing of a person healed from leprosy and the purification of a house affected by a similar plague. These instructions emphasize God's holiness, the role of the priesthood in mediating purification, and the importance of ritual cleanliness for community restoration.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - The Wilderness Period after the Exodus

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The leader and prophet to whom the LORD spoke the laws concerning leprosy and purification.

keyCharacters.name: Priest
keyCharacters.description: The religious official responsible for examining the leper, performing cleansing rituals, and pronouncing cleanliness.

keyCharacters.name: Leper
keyCharacters.description: The individual afflicted with leprosy who seeks cleansing and restoration to the community.

keyCharacters.name: Owner of the House
keyCharacters.description: The person who reports a suspected leprous plague in their house to the priest for inspection and cleansing.

definitions.definition: A term used in the Old Testament to describe various skin diseases causing ritual uncleanness, not necessarily the modern disease Hansen's disease.
A sin offering made to atone for unintentional sins or impurities, restoring fellowship with God.
A small plant used in purification rituals to sprinkle blood or water, symbolizing cleansing and sanctification.
A ritual in which an offering is waved before the LORD symbolizing dedication and consecration.
Flowing water used in purification rites, symbolizing continual cleansing and life.

outline.heading: Cleansing of the Leper
outline.description: God instructs Moses on the procedure for the priest to examine a healed leper, including the use of two birds, cedar wood, scarlet, and hyssop for ritual cleansing, symbolizing purification and restoration.

outline.heading: Offerings for Cleansing
outline.description: Detailed instructions on the offerings required for cleansing, including lambs, flour, oil, and birds, with provisions for the poor, emphasizing the seriousness of sin and the need for atonement.

outline.heading: Cleansing of a Leprous House
outline.description: Procedures for identifying and purifying a house affected by leprous plague, including inspection, removal of contaminated stones, and ritual cleansing with birds and cedar, illustrating God's concern for holiness in all areas of life.

outline.heading: Summary of Leprosy Laws
outline.description: A concluding statement summarizing the laws concerning various forms of leprosy and their purpose to distinguish between clean and unclean.

application: Recognize the importance of spiritual cleansing through Christ, who fulfills the role of the ultimate High Priest offering perfect atonement.
Approach God with reverence and obedience, understanding that holiness requires separation from sin and impurity.
Trust in God's provision for restoration and renewal, even after seasons of brokenness or uncleanness.
Practice confession and repentance regularly, allowing God to cleanse and restore fellowship.

keyVerses.text: And he shall sprinkle upon him that is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let the living bird loose into the open field.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the priest's role in declaring a person clean, symbolizing God's forgiveness and the restoration of the individual to the community.

keyVerses.text: And the priest shall offer the sin offering, and make an atonement for him that is to be cleansed from his uncleanness; and afterward he shall kill the burnt offering:
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes the necessity of atonement for uncleanness, pointing forward to the ultimate sacrifice of Jesus Christ for our sins.

keyVerses.text: But he shall let go the living bird out of the city into the open fields, and make an atonement for the house: and it shall be clean.
keyVerses.significance: This verse symbolizes the removal of sin and impurity, signifying complete cleansing and restoration.
